name: MetLife Stadium
description: Home of the 2026 World Cup Final. The stadium will be temporarily renamed for the tournament and will host the most anticipated match in world football.

name: AT&T Stadium
description: The largest World Cup 2026 venue by capacity. Features a retractable roof and the world's largest column-free interior. Home stadium of the Dallas Cowboys.

name: Estadio Azteca
description: The only stadium to host three FIFA World Cups (1970, 1986, 2026). Legendary venue where Maradona's 'Hand of God' and 'Goal of the Century' took place. Will host the Opening Match.

name: SoFi Stadium
description: State-of-the-art venue that will be temporarily renamed 'Los Angeles Stadium' during the tournament. Features a stunning architectural design and cutting-edge technology.

name: Hard Rock Stadium
description: Located in South Florida, this venue brings World Cup action to one of America's most vibrant international cities with strong Latin American connections.

name: Mercedes-Benz Stadium
description: Features a unique retractable roof and award-winning design. Home to Atlanta United FC, one of MLS's most successful and well-supported teams.

name: Gillette Stadium
description: Serving the Boston/New England region, this venue brings World Cup football to the historic northeastern United States.

name: Lincoln Financial Field
description: Located in the birthplace of American democracy, this venue will host World Cup matches in Philadelphia, a city with rich sports history.

name: NRG Stadium
description: Features a retractable roof perfect for Houston's climate. Brings World Cup action to Texas's largest city and a major hub for Latin American culture.

name: Arrowhead Stadium
description: Known as one of the loudest stadiums in the world. Home of the Kansas City Chiefs and will bring legendary atmosphere to World Cup matches.

name: Levi's Stadium
description: Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, this modern venue brings World Cup football to the tech capital of the world.

name: Lumen Field
description: Home to the Seattle Sounders, one of MLS's most passionate fanbases. Known for its incredible atmosphere on match days.

name: Estadio Akron
description: Home of Chivas, one of Mexico's most popular football clubs. Features a distinctive volcanic design inspired by Mexican culture.

name: Estadio BBVA
description: One of the most modern stadiums in the Americas. Home to CF Monterrey and known for its striking contemporary architecture.

name: BC Place
description: Features a retractable roof and stunning views of Vancouver's mountains. Home to the Vancouver Whitecaps FC.

name: BMO Field
description: Canada's premier football-specific stadium. Home to Toronto FC and will showcase World Cup action in Canada's largest city.
